studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Incorporation of Nonsubstantial Amendment 6 into the protocol version 5.1.
Updated survival follow-up and Quality of Life (QoL) data collection requirements following the final Overall Survival (OS) analysis.
Added provisions for study continuity and transition of subjects to other Astellas-sponsored studies.

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: To define the completion of survival follow-up and QoL assessments once the target number of OS events is reached.
To provide a mechanism for subjects receiving clinical benefit to continue treatment after study termination.

studyChanges.afterText: Once the final number of events has been reached to trigger the final OS analysis, survival follow-up will be considered complete and subjects will be discontinued from long term follow-up.
studyChanges.summary: Clarified the end of long-term survival follow-up.

studyChanges.afterText: Once the final number of events has been reached to trigger the final OS analysis, sites will no longer be required to collect EQ-5D-5L, QLQ-PR25, FACT-P for QoL and BPI-SF.
studyChanges.summary: Discontinued QoL and pain assessment collection after final OS analysis.

studyChanges.beforeText: At the time of primary endpoint analysis... subjects may be asked to continue their open-label treatment in another Astellas-sponsored study.
studyChanges.afterText: Subjects who are continuing to receive clinical benefit from treatment with enzalutamide after the OS analysis data cutoff or at study termination... may continue their open-label treatment in another Astellas-sponsored study.
studyChanges.summary: Updated criteria for transitioning subjects to open-label extension or other studies based on clinical benefit.
